channel.title: LSTM on Memo Tut
channel.description: Recent content in LSTM on Memo Tut

item.title: [Python] Nikkei Prediction with Pytorch
item.description: I am a graduate student studying Pytorch recently. I started studying neural networks by dreaming about stock price forecasts and horse racing forecasts. At last, it is in shape, so I will write it as a memorandum. I hope it will be helpful for a beginner like me. References, cited articles and books Overview of LSTM network This is an article about the network structure and mechanism of LSTM.

item.title: [Python] College students who don't want to read English papers (python)
item.description: # I want to read English papers easily! !! !! Since I am not good at English and I can’t go on to learn more, I thought there would be a way to have fun. The idea I came up with would be something like a summary and translate that English sentence… Operation confirmation environment Windows10 Powershell (even cmd is OK) Google Colaboratory Python 3.7.3 What is Colaboratory Colaboratory is a Jupyter notebook environment that runs entirely in the cloud.

item.title: [Python] I tried to predict the deterioration of the lithium ion battery using Qore SDK
item.description: #Introduction Hi everyone, this is kon2 :sunny::sunny: I am a student who usually studies negative electrode materials for lithium batteries at university. Lithium-ion batteries are widely used in everyday life such as mobile phones and electric vehicles. Since you recently won the Nobel Prize, you often hear the name. Although lithium-ion batteries have been in commercial use for more than 40 years, they are still an active research field, and the use of machine learning has recently been drawing attention.

item.title: [Python] I checked the output specification of PyTorch Bidirectional LSTM
item.description: #Introduction As stated in LSTM Reference,whenhandlingBidirectionalLSTMwithPyTorch,whendeclaringLSTMIt’sOKtospecifybidirectional=Trueinthe,anditisveryeasytohandle(KerascanjustsurroundtheLSTMwithBidrectional). However, even if I look at the reference, I don’t think much about the output when LSTM is set to Bidirectional. I didn’t quite understand the output specifications of Bidirectional LSTM in PyTorch even after a quick google, so I will briefly summarize here. #Reference Bidirectional recurrent neural networks Understanding Bidirectional RNN in PyTorch Bidirectional LSTM output question in PyTorch Understanding LSTM-along with recent trends Specification check As you can see from References 1 and 2, you can see that the bidirectional RNN and LSTM are simple because the front and rear RNNs and LSTMs overlap.

item.title: [Python] Sine curve estimation with self-made deep learning module (python) + LSTM
item.description: 2017.9.16 Added. Recently I upgraded a little. https://github.com/uyuutosa/Optimizer_with_theano Also, I made it possible to try neural style by copy and paste. http://qiita.com/uyuutosa/items/09557f2f99e77a1b9cc2 For reference only. I made my own deep learning module in Python (on the way). For my own study. The name is Optimizer with no twist. We aim to establish a network with a small number of keystrokes. I use theano internally, but I think that Define by Run chainer is upward compatible, so May change to chainer.
